intro: Microgynella trifurcata, commonly known as the three-branched microgynella, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in wetland and swampy habitats. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-yellow and are arranged in clusters. It is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
